intro: Pedicularis pyrenaica var. donnayi, commonly known as the Pyrenean lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes hemiparasitic plants that derive some of their nutrients from host plants. The species is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers, which bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often in open, sunny areas. The plant's morphology includes erect stems and lance-shaped leaves, with a distinct floral structure that facilitates pollination by insects.
